stock.model.dao

Interface DAOInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DAOcsv, DAOWebAPI

    public interface DAOInterface
    This generic interface represents the Data Access Objects. It fetches the information from the specified data source. It defines operations to buy stock from market and to view its value on specified date. It can access various sources and return the required information.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Map<IStock,java.lang.Integer> buyStockFromMarket(java.lang.String tickerSymbol, java.lang.Double amount, java.time.LocalDateTime dateOfPurchase)
      This method is used to buy the stock from the specified stock market.
      double valueOfStockOnDate(java.lang.String tickerSymbol, java.time.LocalDateTime date)
      Fetches the value of the stock on specified date in the format of 2 digits after decimal, $x.yz.

    • Method Detail

      • buyStockFromMarket

        java.util.Map<IStock,java.lang.Integer> buyStockFromMarket(java.lang.String tickerSymbol,
                                                           java.lang.Double amount,
                                                           java.time.LocalDateTime dateOfPurchase)
        This method is used to buy the stock from the specified stock market.
        Parameters:
        tickerSymbol - is unique symbol given to each company for trading purposes.
        amount - the amount of money spent to buy this stock.
        Returns:
        Map of T and the number of T bought for the specified amount.

      • valueOfStockOnDate

        double valueOfStockOnDate(java.lang.String tickerSymbol,
                          java.time.LocalDateTime date)
        Fetches the value of the stock on specified date in the format of 2 digits after decimal, $x.yz.
        Parameters:
        tickerSymbol - is unique symbol given to each company for trading purposes.
        date - is the date at which the value is to be fetched.
        Returns:
        the amount of the stock at specified date.
